summary: This is a detailed victim claim submitted to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program by Jane Doe 43 through her attorneys at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP. The document alleges she was recruited into Epstein's sex-trafficking ring at age 22 in 2006, subjected to repeated sexual abuse and control by Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell on his private island and in New York, and forced to perform sex acts with Alan Dershowitz and others. It details her escape, subsequent legal action, and the severe physical and psychological harm she suffered.

persons.name: Jane Doe 43
persons.context: The claimant who alleges she was recruited into Epstein's sex-trafficking ring at age 22 in 2006, subjected to sexual abuse on his private island and in New York, and forced to perform sex acts with Alan Dershowitz and others.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central accused perpetrator who allegedly recruited, controlled, and sexually abused the claimant, forced her into dangerous dieting, and interfered with her legal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Allegedly directed and managed the claimant and other girls for Epstein's sexual abuse, enforced schedules, and manipulated the claimant with false promises.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Allegedly involved in a sexual encounter with the claimant that she was forced into by Epstein at his New York mansion.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Named as a defendant alongside Epstein and Maxwell in the claimant's 2017 lawsuit (17-cv-00616).

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP who submitted the claim to the Compensation Program on behalf of the claimant.

persons.name: Marci A. Hamilton
persons.context: Professor the claimant requests the Administrator consult with in reviewing her claim.

persons.name: Richard Berman
persons.context: The Honorable Judge before whom the claimant spoke in open court after Epstein's death to tell her story.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to Epstein's plea deal, which triggered the claimant's suicide attempt in 2008.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: Named by the claimant in a media interview as someone who, like Maxwell, is still 'walking the streets' and needs to be stopped.

persons.name: Chris Dyer
persons.context: Author of a Daily Mail Online article cited about an Epstein victim's escape attempt.

connections.description: Epstein allegedly recruited, controlled, sexually abused, and trafficked the claimant for nearly a year.
Maxwell allegedly directed and managed the claimant for Epstein's abuse, enforced sex schedules, and manipulated her with false promises about school admission.
Described as co-conspirators who worked together to traffic and abuse the claimant and other girls.
The claimant alleges she was forced by Epstein to perform sexual acts with Dershowitz, his lawyer and friend.
Described as Epstein's lawyer and friend.
McCawley is the attorney who submitted this compensation claim on behalf of the claimant.
Implied connection as the claimant groups Brunel with Maxwell as Epstein's co-conspirators who are still free.

events.title: Recruitment and Initial Abuse
events.description: Jane Doe 43, age 22, moved to New York, was recruited by an Epstein recruiter at a nightclub, and shortly after was taken to Epstein's private island where sexual abuse began.

events.title: Email about FIT Admission
events.description: Reference to an email regarding the claimant's application to the Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT), part of Epstein's false promises.

events.title: Claimant's Suicide Attempt
events.description: The claimant attempted suicide and was in a coma for four weeks after being triggered by media reports of Epstein's plea deal with Alexander Acosta.

events.title: Claimant Comes Forward
events.description: Jane Doe 43 came forward about the abuse.

events.title: Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Jane Doe 43 filed a lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Lesley Groff (17-cv-00616).

events.title: Second Suicide Attempt During Litigation
events.description: The claimant attempted suicide again due to fear of Epstein while her civil case was pending.

events.title: Epstein Bail Hearing
events.description: Reference to a bail hearing for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Claimant Speaks in Court After Epstein's Death
events.description: Jane Doe 43 stood up in open court before Judge Richard Berman to tell her story after Epstein died.

events.title: Netflix Documentary Airs
events.description: The documentary 'Jeffrey Epstein: Filthy Rich' aired, featuring an interview with the claimant.

locations: Brazil, France, South Africa (mentioned as places co-conspirators might flee)
keyFacts: The claimant alleges she was forced by Jeffrey Epstein to perform sexual acts with his lawyer and friend, Alan Dershowitz.
The claimant attempted to escape Epstein's private island by swimming away but was caught by a search party and punished.
Epstein allegedly put the claimant on a dangerous low-calorie diet to make her thinner, causing kidney problems, and used an assistant to monitor her weight.

The government discovered Epstein attempted to sabotage the claimant's lawsuit by making large payments ($250,000 and $100,000) to a friend and an employee who were fact witnesses, causing them to stop cooperating.
The claimant states that after she came forward, she was followed in Europe by individuals she believes were hired by Epstein to scare her.
